required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study To Evaluate Long Term Maintenance With TRIZIVIR After Boosted Protease Inhibitor (PI) Or Non-Nucleoside Reverse Transcriptase Inhibitor (NNRTI) In HIV-1 Infected Adults
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of a Treatment Optimisation With Trizivir During 96 Weeks After a First Antiretroviral Treatment in HIV-1 Infected Subjects.

brief_summary.textblock: The current goal of antiretroviral therapy is to use a potent regimen that will suppress plasma viral load and maintain this suppression as long as possible. However, for most patients treated with such potent regimen, several problems can limit their long term effectiveness and contribute to incomplete viral suppression. These problems include poor tolerability, metabolic toxic effects. In order to avoid common problems as toxicity it might be interested to simplify treatment with fewer toxicity, lower pill burden. In this study we will evaluate the safety and efficacy of a simplification treatment with TRIZIVIR in long term after a Boosted PI or NNRTI containing regimen as first line therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with a HIV plasma RNA<50 copies/ml at 48 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with a HIV plasma RNA<50 copies/ml at 48 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with a HIV plasma RNA <50copies/ml at 96 weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with a HIV plasma RNA <50copies/ml at 96 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: CD4 count profile at baseline 24 W,48 and 96 W
secondary_outcome.description: CD4 count profile at baseline 24,48, and 96 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Determination of compliance of patient to treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Determination of compliance of patient to treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients having a viral load <50 copies/mlL at 96 weeks in the ITT (M=F) population;
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients having a viral load <50 copies/mlL at 96 weeks in the ITT (M=F) population

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with a virl load <50 copies/mL at 96 weeks (per protocol population)
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with a viral load <50 copies/mL at 96 weeks (per protocol population)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with a viral load <5 copies/mL at 96 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients with a viral load <5 copies/mL at 96 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in CD4 counts at 24, 48, 96 weeks; Genotypic resistance profile of the HIV-1 in the event of virological failure CV >1000 copies/mL, as confirmed twice; Time to virologic failure (by Kaplan - Meier)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in CD4 counts at 24, 48, 96 weeks; Genotypic resistance profile of the HIV-1 in the event of virological failure CV >1000 copies/mL, as confirmed twice; Time to virologic failure (by Kaplan - Meier)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient adherence (using the PMAQ3 instrument); Retrospective determination of HLAB57 as a marker for hypersensitivity reaction in patients randomized to the Trizivir arm.
secondary_outcome.description: Patient adherence (using the PMAQ3 instrument); Retrospective determination of HLAB57 as a marker for hypersensitivity reaction in patients randomized to the Trizivir arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Quantitative measurement of the residual replicative capacity (using cell-based assay) using number of quiescent cells and quantification of proviral DNA.
secondary_outcome.description: Quantitative measurement of the residual replicative capacity (using cell-based assay) using number of quiescent cells and quantification of proviral DNA.
